alert.note: Alert for Delano-Wasco-Shafter; South End Sierra Foothills; Southeast San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 3:11PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kern County through 345 PM PST... At 311 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 12 miles east of Shafter, or 13 miles north of Bakersfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bakersfield, Shafter and Oildale. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Delano-Wasco-Shafter; South End Sierra Foothills; Southeast San Joaquin Valley
